actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 544 (Sen. Tester):
        A resolution designating the week beginning February 5, 2024, as "National Tribal Colleges and Universities Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN308:
        Nicole Shampaine, of California, a Career Member of the Senior Foreign Service, Class of Minister-Counselor, for the rank of Ambassador during her tenure of service as United States Representative to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN1113:
        Kurt Campbell, of the District of Columbia, to be Deputy Secretary of State

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 90 - 5. Record Vote Number: 35 


        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 92 - 5. Record Vote Number: 36 



 PN1239:
        Amy M. Baggio, of Oregon, to be United States District Judge for the District of Oregon

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 43. Record Vote Number: 37 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 44. Record Vote Number: 38
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Wyden, at  6:49 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 12 noon tomorrow.
